headline.main: Phillips 66 Says Construction Continues on Dakota Access Pipeline
headline.print_headline: Phillips 66 Says Construction Continues on Dakota Access Pipeline

docs.snippet: Construction is continuing on the Dakota Access Pipeline (DAPL) even as a dispute with Native Americans has blocked work on a section of the project, the chief executive of Phillips 66, which owns 25 percent of the project, said on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Construction is continuing on the Dakota Access Pipeline (DAPL) even as a dispute with Native Americans has blocked work on a section of the project, the chief executive of Phillips 66, which owns 25 percent of the project, said on Friday.

headline.main: Morrison Raises Marmite Price by 12 Percent After 'Marmitegate'
headline.print_headline: Morrison Raises Marmite Price by 12 Percent After 'Marmitegate'

docs.snippet: British supermarket chain Morrison has raised the price of Marmite yeast spread by 12 percent, passing on to consumers an increase sought by its maker Unilever that led to a row with retailer Tesco this month dubbed "Marmitegate"....
docs.lead_paragraph: British supermarket chain Morrison has raised the price of Marmite yeast spread by 12 percent, passing on to consumers an increase sought by its maker Unilever that led to a row with retailer Tesco this month dubbed "Marmitegate".

headline.main: Enslaved Teen Boys Dial for Help From Indian Shoe Factory
headline.print_headline: Enslaved Teen Boys Dial for Help From Indian Shoe Factory

docs.snippet: Police have rescued 10 teenage boys, allegedly trafficked and held in bondage in a shoe-sole factory in the southern Indian state of Karnataka, after a tip-off from a children's helpline....
docs.lead_paragraph: Police have rescued 10 teenage boys, allegedly trafficked and held in bondage in a shoe-sole factory in the southern Indian state of Karnataka, after a tip-off from a children's helpline.

headline.main: Soylent Says It Will Remake Two of Its Meal Replacers After Customers Became Ill

docs.snippet: The announcement is the latest in a string of setbacks by the company that wants powders to replace meals, but many customers remain faithful....
docs.lead_paragraph: The announcement is the latest in a string of setbacks by the company that wants powders to replace meals, but many customers remain faithful.

headline.main: Chinese Vessels Leave Disputed Fishing Grounds in South China Sea
headline.print_headline: Chinese Vessels Retreat From Disputed Fishing Zone

docs.snippet: China’s Coast Guard had chased Filipino fishermen from the grounds, but has abandoned them since a visit from the Philippine president, Rodrigo Duterte, to Beijing....

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Beijing, and Felipe Villamor from Manila.

docs.lead_paragraph: China’s Coast Guard had chased Filipino fishermen from the grounds, but has abandoned them since a visit from the Philippine president, Rodrigo Duterte, to Beijing.

headline.main: Russia Fails to Win Re-election to U.N. Human Rights Council
headline.print_headline: Russia Fails to Win Re-election to U.N. Human Rights Council

docs.snippet: Russia failed to win re-election to the United Nations Human Rights Council on Friday, beaten out by Hungary and Croatia, following lobbying by rights groups against Moscow's candidacy because of its military support for the Syrian government....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia failed to win re-election to the United Nations Human Rights Council on Friday, beaten out by Hungary and Croatia, following lobbying by rights groups against Moscow's candidacy because of its military support for the Syrian government.

headline.main: Factbox: Uber Faces Legal Challenges in Many Countries
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Uber Faces Legal Challenges in Many Countries

docs.snippet: Uber [UBER.UL] should no longer treat its drivers as self-employed, a British tribunal ruled on Friday, in a decision that threatens the taxi app's business model by forcing it to pay the minimum wage and offer holiday entitlement....
docs.lead_paragraph: Uber [UBER.UL] should no longer treat its drivers as self-employed, a British tribunal ruled on Friday, in a decision that threatens the taxi app's business model by forcing it to pay the minimum wage and offer holiday entitlement.

headline.main: Ronaldo Angry About Lack of Goals, Says Zidane
headline.print_headline: Ronaldo Angry About Lack of Goals, Says Zidane

docs.snippet: Cristiano Ronaldo is angry with his recent record in front of goal but not anxious about when he will find the net next, Real Madrid coach Zinedine Zidane said on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cristiano Ronaldo is angry with his recent record in front of goal but not anxious about when he will find the net next, Real Madrid coach Zinedine Zidane said on Friday.

headline.main: Arrestor Beds Help Prevent Disaster on Pence's Campaign Jet
headline.print_headline: Arrestor Beds Help Prevent Disaster on Pence's Campaign Jet

docs.snippet: A field of aerated cement blocks that crumble under the weight of an aircraft helped prevent Republican vice presidential nominee Mike Pence's campaign plane from barreling off a runway and onto a busy parkway nearby....
docs.lead_paragraph: A field of aerated cement blocks that crumble under the weight of an aircraft helped prevent Republican vice presidential nominee Mike Pence's campaign plane from barreling off a runway and onto a busy parkway nearby.

headline.main: Letter Shows Malta Gave Clearance to Fuel Russian Tanker
headline.print_headline: Letter Shows Malta Gave Clearance to Fuel Russian Tanker

docs.snippet: Malta gave diplomatic clearance to a Russian tanker a week before the foreign minister said the country would not refuel Russian ships, a letter obtained by The Associated Press shows....
docs.lead_paragraph: Malta gave diplomatic clearance to a Russian tanker a week before the foreign minister said the country would not refuel Russian ships, a letter obtained by The Associated Press shows.
